results.title: Crossbanding and jointing veneers
results.creator_credit: Topical Film Company and K. Baron Hartley
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”.
Both sides of the wood are veneered to prevent warping. The method of making this is demonstrated through an example of a door made of laminated wood. It is explained how to veneer the face of the door to match the edges and when a piece of veneer is not wide enough to cover a surface, how a joint must be made.

results.title: The Sentence of the court
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Scene”.
This docudrama looks at what the subsequent history might have been of the boys in the gang that attacked the conductor in the film the “Last Bus” (Title code 006006). Examines the factors which might have caused the boys behaviour, their likely punishment and its effect on them. Companion film to “Last Bus”.

results.title: The Great zoos of the world, Frankfurt
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Scene”.
A tour of the Frankfurt Zoo, showing the influence Dr Bernhard Grzimek, the Director, has had on the kind of animals in the collection and they way in which they are displayed. Also looks at the question of having one man in sole charge of a zoo.

results.title: Last bus
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Scene”.
A docudrama featuring a group of teenage boys who attack a bus conductor on a late night journey. None of the passengers go to the conductor’s aid. Afterwards the passengers try to justify their inactivity to an interviewer who tries to discover why the boys did it. See companion film “The Sentence of the court” (Title code 009645).

group_siblings.title: The Great zoos of the world, Frankfurt

results.title: From forest to timber yard
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”.
Film opens with a short description, aided by diagrams, of the structure of hard and soft woods followed by a demonstration on the correct way of felling trees, cutting the logs into boards and stacking to dry. The film concludes by listing the woods suitable for different types of work, eg oak and mahogany for cabinet making; pine and fir for carpentry; ash and elm for the wheelwright; and lime and maple for carving.

results.title: Union is strength: the story of plywood
results.creator_credit: K. Baron Hartley and Brent Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”
The structure of wood makes it liable to split or be broken along the grain. This film describes how this tendency can be overcome by the construction of plywood.
